awardEventDetails.title: 2016 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.description: (MAD MAX: FURY ROAD explodes with apocalyptic anarchy - a journey of fire and blood through which the action genre is razed to the ground and reborn. Visionary director George Miller drives the creative engine that fuels this cinematic fever dream with poetic rage and balletic brutality. Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron are the hardened heroes of this blockbuster bacchanal, breathing fearless purpose into chaos with steely, human resolve.)

awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Feature Film

awardEventDetails.title: 2016 Winner Taurus World Stunt Award
awardEventDetails.description: Judd Wild (stunt performer) - Craig Morgan (stunt performer) - Sebastian Dickins (stunt performer) - Pete Hill (stunt performer) - Chris Patton (stunt performer) (Stunt men are on top of giant poles made to move like metronomes, with two men on the bottom to assist the movement of the poles. The poles were on moving cars that chased a tanker. All performers were then able to transfer from the top of their pole to the tanker or pull people from cars. Some stunt performers were also holding weapons and props.)

2016 Winner AFI Award
Movie of the Year
(MAD MAX: FURY ROAD explodes with apocalyptic anarchy - a journey of fire and blood through which the action genre is razed to the ground and reborn. Visionary director George Miller drives the creative engine that fuels this cinematic fever dream with poetic rage and balletic brutality. Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron are the hardened heroes of this blockbuster bacchanal, breathing fearless purpose into chaos with steely, human resolve.)
